bibdata.title: IEEE Standard for Submersible, Three-Phase Transformers, 3750 kVA and Smaller: High Voltage, 34 500 GrdY/19 920 Volts and Below; Low Voltage, 600 Volts and Below
Redline
IEEE Standard for Submersible, Three-Phase Transformers, 3750 kVA and Smaller: High Voltage, 34 500 GrdY/19 920 Volts and Below; Low Voltage, 600 Volts and Below - Redline
bibdata.docidentifier: IEEE Std C57.12.24-2016 (Revison of IEEE Std C57.12.24-2009) - Redline

organization.name: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers

bibdata.abstract: Certain electrical, dimensional, and mechanical characteristics are covered in this standard. It also takes into consideration certain safety features of three-phase, 60 Hz, liquid-immersed, self-cooled, submersible transformers with separable insulated high-voltage connectors. These transformers are rated 3750 kVA and smaller with high voltages of 34 500 GrdY/19 920 V and below and with low voltages of 600 V and below.

organization.name: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers

bibitem.formattedref: IEEE Std C57.12.24-2009 (Revision of IEEE Std C57.12.24-1994)
